canonical_explanation.text: Class 10 constructions include: dividing a line segment in a given ratio, constructing a triangle similar to a given triangle with a given scale factor, and constructing tangents to a circle from an external point or from a point on the circle.
rules: To divide a line segment AB in ratio m:n, draw a ray at an angle and mark (m+n) equal parts
To construct a similar triangle with scale factor m/n (m < n), the new triangle is smaller
To construct a similar triangle with scale factor m/n (m > n), the new triangle is larger
To construct tangent from an external point P: join OP, find midpoint M, draw circle with radius MP
To construct tangent at a point on the circle: draw radius and construct perpendicular

questions.question_text: To divide a line segment AB in the ratio 3:4, we draw a ray AX making an acute angle with AB. The minimum number of points to be marked on AX is:
questions.explanation_correct: To divide in ratio m:n, mark m + n = 3 + 4 = 7 points on the ray.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The number of points = sum of the parts of the ratio = 3 + 4 = 7.

questions.question_text: To divide a line segment AB in the ratio 5:3, a ray AX is drawn. After marking 8 equal points A1, A2, ..., A8, which point is joined to B?
questions.explanation_correct: The last point (A8, since 5+3=8) is joined to B. Then a line through A5 parallel to A8B gives the division point.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Join the last marked point (A8) to B, then draw a parallel through A5 to get the ratio 5:3.

questions.question_text: To divide a line segment in the ratio 2:3, the total number of equal parts marked on the ray is 5.
questions.explanation_correct: Total parts = 2 + 3 = 5. So 5 equal arcs are marked on the ray.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sum of the ratio parts (2 + 3 = 5) gives the total number of points to mark.

questions.question_text: A line segment of length 7.6 cm is to be divided in the ratio 5:8 internally. The point P divides it such that AP is:
questions.explanation_incorrect: AP = (5/13) x 7.6 = 2.923 cm approximately.

questions.question_text: To divide segment PQ in ratio 3:2, a ray PX is drawn. Points are marked at equal distances. A line parallel to which segment is drawn through the 3rd point?

options.text: The line joining 5th point to Q
The line joining 3rd point to Q
The line joining 2nd point to Q

questions.explanation_correct: Mark 5 points (3+2=5). Join the 5th point to Q. Draw a line through the 3rd point parallel to this line.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Join the last (5th) point to Q, then draw parallel through the 3rd point.

questions.question_text: To construct a triangle similar to triangle ABC with scale factor 3/4, the new triangle will be:
questions.explanation_correct: Scale factor 3/4 < 1, so the new triangle is smaller than the original.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A scale factor less than 1 means the similar triangle is smaller.

questions.question_text: To construct a triangle similar to triangle ABC with scale factor 5/3, how many points are marked on the ray?
questions.explanation_correct: Scale factor = 5/3. The larger of 5 and 3 is 5. So mark 5 points on the ray.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Mark max(numerator, denominator) = max(5, 3) = 5 points.

questions.question_text: To construct a triangle similar to ABC with scale factor 3/5, we mark 5 points on ray BX. We join B5 to C and draw a line through ___ parallel to B5C.
questions.explanation_correct: For scale factor 3/5, join B5 to C and draw parallel through B3 (the numerator-th point).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Draw parallel to B5C through B3 (where 3 is the numerator of the scale factor).

questions.question_text: A triangle similar to a given triangle with scale factor 1 is congruent to the given triangle.
questions.explanation_correct: Scale factor 1 means all sides have the same ratio (1:1), so the triangles are congruent.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Scale factor of 1 means sides are in ratio 1:1, giving a congruent triangle.

questions.question_text: To construct a triangle with sides 5/3 times the corresponding sides of a given triangle, the minimum number of points to locate on a ray is:
questions.explanation_correct: Scale factor = 5/3. Mark max(5, 3) = 5 points on the ray.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Number of points = larger of numerator and denominator = 5.

questions.question_text: To construct a tangent to a circle at a given point, the first step is to:

options.text: Join the centre to the given point (draw the radius)
Draw a chord through the point

questions.explanation_correct: Draw the radius to the point of tangency, then construct a perpendicular to this radius at the point.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The tangent is perpendicular to the radius at the point of contact, so first draw the radius.

questions.question_text: To construct tangents from an external point P to a circle with centre O, the key construction step involves:

options.text: Drawing a circle with OP as diameter
Drawing OP and bisecting the radius
Finding the midpoint of the radius

questions.explanation_correct: Find midpoint M of OP. Draw a circle with centre M and radius MO = MP. This circle intersects the given circle at the points of tangency.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A circle with OP as diameter passes through the points where tangents touch, since the angle in a semicircle is 90 degrees.

questions.question_text: To draw tangents to a circle of radius 3 cm from a point 7 cm from the centre, the radius of the construction circle (with OP as diameter) is:
questions.explanation_correct: The construction circle has OP as diameter, so its radius = OP/2 = 7/2 = 3.5 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Radius of construction circle = OP/2 = 7/2 = 3.5 cm.

questions.question_text: From a point P, tangents PA and PB are drawn to a circle. The angle subtended by AB at the centre O is 120 degrees. Find angle APB.
questions.explanation_correct: In quadrilateral OAPB: angle OAP = angle OBP = 90. angle AOB + angle APB = 180. angle APB = 180 - 120 = 60 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: angle AOB + angle APB = 180 (in quadrilateral OAPB). So angle APB = 60 degrees.

questions.question_text: In the division of a line segment AB in ratio m:n, the construction is based on which theorem?
questions.explanation_correct: The construction uses BPT (Thales' theorem): a line parallel to one side of a triangle divides the other two sides proportionally.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The division construction is justified by the Basic Proportionality Theorem.

questions.question_text: To construct a triangle with sides 2/3 times the sides of triangle ABC, the scale factor is ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The scale factor is directly given as 2/3 (ratio of new side to original side).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Scale factor = new side / original side = 2/3.

questions.question_text: To construct tangents from point P to a circle, we need to find points where tangents touch. These points lie on the intersection of the given circle and:

options.text: A circle with OP as diameter
A line through P parallel to a diameter

questions.explanation_correct: The circle with OP as diameter intersects the given circle at the points of tangency, because the angle in a semicircle is 90 degrees (tangent is perpendicular to radius).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Angle in semicircle = 90 degrees = angle between tangent and radius. So the tangency points lie on this circle.

questions.question_text: A line segment AB = 8 cm is divided in ratio 3:5. The length of the smaller part is:
questions.explanation_correct: Smaller part = 3/(3+5) x 8 = 3/8 x 8 = 3 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Smaller part = (3/8) x 8 = 3 cm.

questions.question_text: When constructing a similar triangle with scale factor 7/4, the resulting triangle is:

options.text: Larger, with sides 7/4 times the original
Smaller, with sides 4/7 times the original

questions.explanation_correct: 7/4 > 1, so the new triangle is larger with each side 7/4 times the corresponding original side.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Scale factor 7/4 > 1 means the new triangle is larger.

questions.question_text: To construct a tangent at a point P on a circle, we construct a line perpendicular to the radius OP at point P.
questions.explanation_correct: The tangent at any point is perpendicular to the radius at that point. So constructing the perpendicular to OP at P gives the tangent.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The tangent is perpendicular to the radius at the point of contact.

questions.question_text: To divide line segment AB in ratio 4:7 internally, ray AX is drawn. Points A1 to A11 are marked. Which point is joined to B?
questions.explanation_correct: Total points = 4 + 7 = 11. The last point A11 is joined to B.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Join the last point (A11) to B, then draw parallel through A4.

questions.question_text: To construct a triangle similar to triangle PQR with scale factor 4/7, we draw ray QX and mark ___ points.
questions.explanation_correct: Number of points = max(4, 7) = 7.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Mark the larger of the numerator and denominator = 7 points.

questions.question_text: A line segment of 10 cm is divided in ratio 1:1. The point of division is at distance ___ from each end.
questions.explanation_correct: Ratio 1:1 means the midpoint. Each part = 10/2 = 5 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 1:1 ratio divides at the midpoint: 5 cm from each end.

questions.question_text: How many tangents can be constructed to a circle from a point at distance d from the centre, if d = r (radius)?
questions.explanation_correct: When d = r, the point is on the circle. From a point on the circle, exactly 1 tangent can be drawn.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A point on the circle (d = r) has exactly one tangent.

questions.question_text: In construction of a similar triangle with scale factor m/n where m > n, the new triangle is ___ than the original.
questions.explanation_correct: When m > n, the scale factor m/n > 1, so the new triangle is larger.
questions.explanation_incorrect: m/n > 1 means enlargement, making the new triangle larger.

questions.question_text: The construction of dividing a line segment uses:
questions.explanation_correct: All NCERT constructions use only compass and straightedge (unmarked ruler).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Standard geometric constructions use only compass and straightedge.

questions.question_text: In the construction of tangents from an external point, the reason we use OP as diameter for a new circle is:

options.text: Angle in a semicircle is 90 degrees, ensuring tangent perpendicularity
OP is the longest line segment

questions.explanation_correct: Any point T on the circle with diameter OP satisfies angle OTP = 90 degrees. If T is also on the original circle, then OT is a radius and OT perpendicular to PT means PT is a tangent.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The semicircle angle property (90 degrees) ensures the radius-tangent perpendicularity condition.

questions.question_text: To divide a 12 cm line segment in ratio 2:3, the two parts are ___ cm and ___ cm.
Construct a triangle similar to a given right triangle with legs 6 and 8 and scale factor 3/5. The legs of the new triangle are:
questions.explanation_correct: New legs = 6 x 3/5 = 3.6 and 8 x 3/5 = 4.8.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Scale factor 3/5 applied: 6 x 3/5 = 3.6, 8 x 3/5 = 4.8.

questions.question_text: From a point 10 cm from the centre of a circle of radius 6 cm, tangents are constructed. The length of each tangent is:
questions.explanation_correct: Tangent length = sqrt(10^2 - 6^2) = sqrt(64) = 8 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: By Pythagoras: tangent = sqrt(100 - 36) = 8 cm.

questions.question_text: When dividing AB in ratio m:n using construction, the ray AX can make:
questions.explanation_correct: The ray can make any acute angle with AB. The construction works regardless of the angle chosen.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Any convenient acute angle works. The actual angle doesn't affect the ratio.

questions.question_text: When constructing a similar triangle with scale factor 2/3, the new triangle has angles different from the original.
questions.explanation_correct: Similar triangles have the same angles regardless of the scale factor. Only the side lengths change.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Similarity preserves angles. All similar triangles have identical angle measures.

questions.question_text: To construct tangent to a circle from external point P, we first need:
questions.explanation_correct: We need the centre O to join OP and find the midpoint M of OP for the construction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The centre is essential to draw OP and construct the semicircle.

questions.question_text: To divide line segment AB = 7 cm in the ratio 2:3, using the basic construction, point P on AB is at distance ___ from A.
questions.explanation_incorrect: AP/AB = 2/5, so AP = 2.8 cm.

questions.question_text: To construct a similar triangle with scale factor 5/7, how many points must be on the ray, and which point is crucial?
questions.explanation_correct: Mark max(5,7) = 7 points. The 5th point (numerator) is where we draw the parallel line.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 7 points are marked. The construction line passes through the 5th point.

questions.question_text: In constructing tangents from P to a circle with centre O and radius r, the construction circle has centre at:
questions.explanation_correct: The construction circle is centred at the midpoint M of OP with radius MO = MP.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Centre of the construction circle = midpoint of OP.

questions.question_text: A line segment of 9 cm is divided in ratio 1:2. The lengths of the two parts are:
questions.explanation_incorrect: 1:2 ratio divides 9 cm into 3 cm and 6 cm.

questions.question_text: Construction of a similar triangle is based on:
questions.explanation_correct: The construction of similar triangles uses BPT to create proportional sides by drawing lines parallel to a side.
questions.explanation_incorrect: BPT (parallel line divides sides proportionally) is the basis for similar triangle construction.

questions.question_text: To construct tangents from P to circle with centre O, the radius of the construction circle is ___ (in terms of OP).
questions.explanation_correct: The construction circle has OP as diameter, so radius = OP/2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Diameter = OP means radius = OP/2.

questions.question_text: In the construction for dividing AB in ratio m:n, the parallel line is drawn using:

options.text: A set of compasses to create equal corresponding angles
A ruler to measure equal lengths

questions.explanation_correct: The parallel line is drawn by constructing equal corresponding angles using a compass, which ensures the line is truly parallel.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Parallel lines in construction are made using compass-based angle copying, not measurement.

questions.question_text: When constructing a triangle with sides 4/3 times a given equilateral triangle of side 6 cm, each side of the new triangle is:
questions.explanation_correct: New side = 6 x 4/3 = 8 cm. The new triangle is also equilateral with side 8 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Each side = 6 x 4/3 = 8 cm.

questions.question_text: It is possible to construct a tangent to a circle from a point inside the circle.
questions.explanation_correct: From a point inside the circle, no tangent can be drawn. Every line through an interior point intersects the circle at two points (secant).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A tangent can only be drawn from a point on or outside the circle, not from inside.

questions.question_text: To divide AB in ratio 3:2, after marking 5 points on ray AX, we join A5 to B and draw a line through ___ parallel to A5B.
questions.explanation_correct: To get ratio 3:2, draw parallel through A3 (the 3rd point). This gives AP:PB = 3:2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The parallel through the m-th point (A3) gives ratio m:n = 3:2.

questions.question_text: To make a triangle with scale factor 2/5, we need the new triangle to have sides that are:
questions.explanation_correct: Scale factor 2/5 means each side of the new triangle is 2/5 of the corresponding side of the original.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Scale factor directly gives the ratio: new side = (2/5) x original side.

questions.question_text: In tangent construction from external point P, if the circle has radius 4 cm and OP = 6 cm, the length of each tangent is:

options.text: Both A and B (they are equal)

questions.explanation_correct: Tangent = sqrt(36 - 16) = sqrt(20) = 2sqrt(5) cm. Options A and B are the same value.
questions.explanation_incorrect: sqrt(20) = 2sqrt(5). Both expressions represent the same length.

questions.question_text: A 15 cm line segment is divided in ratio 2:3. The point of division is at ___ cm from the end corresponding to ratio 2.
questions.explanation_correct: Part corresponding to 2 = (2/5) x 15 = 6 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The part in ratio 2 = 2/(2+3) x 15 = 6 cm.

questions.question_text: In constructing a similar triangle, the corresponding angles of the new and original triangles are:

options.text: In the same ratio as sides

questions.explanation_correct: Similar triangles have equal corresponding angles regardless of the scale factor.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Similarity always preserves angles. Only side lengths change proportionally.

questions.question_text: The number of tangents that can be drawn to a circle from a point outside it is:
questions.explanation_correct: From any external point, exactly 2 tangents can be drawn to a circle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An external point always has exactly 2 tangent lines to any circle.

questions.question_text: When a line segment AB is divided in ratio 7:3, the total number of equal arcs on the ray is ___.
questions.explanation_correct: Total arcs = 7 + 3 = 10.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sum of ratio parts = 7 + 3 = 10.

questions.question_text: A triangle ABC has sides 4 cm, 5 cm, and 6 cm. A similar triangle is constructed with scale factor 3/2. The perimeter of the new triangle is:
questions.explanation_correct: Original perimeter = 15 cm. New perimeter = 15 x 3/2 = 22.5 cm. (Or: new sides 6, 7.5, 9 sum to 22.5.)
questions.explanation_incorrect: New perimeter = original perimeter x scale factor = 15 x 3/2 = 22.5 cm.
